titleStmt.title: Alfred C. Tanner et al. to Unknown
CWG10579

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: The Undersigned Would Respectfully Represent to Your Honer the Govenor of Kentucky that at the March Term 1861. of the MLean Circuit Court there was Judgment Rendered against Geo J Hatch for the Sum of Fifty Dollars & Cost. for carying conceald weapons. Your petitioners would Respectfully Represent that it is a great Hardship for the Said Hatch to pay said Amount he being a man in moderate Circumstances and having a family to Support these Hard Times We Would Respectfully Recommend to Your Honor that the Said fine Ought to be Remitted in all good Conscience

and in Doing so who Will be much Obliged
Yours &c
Chas H Trakelie
A J Gilliam
C H Wall
B Cretcher
E, P, Moseley
R Humphrey
L. W. Gates
Geo. Wright
Sam France
Alf C Tanner
W Calhoun
Ben Tanner
Z. B. Firunden
Q Bird Biggs
John Erwin
D. D. Erwin
W. H. Johnson
A. H. Edds
P. H Bennett
R J Jennings
J Sanders Sanders
Peter C Lindley
Alfred Nation

McLean Cir. Ct
$50 } Weapons
Geo. J. Hatch
Remitted May 13th 1861
